revised_title: Microscopic Observations on the Palates of Oxen
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Anatomy and Physiology
tldr: The author, Anthony van Leeuwenhoek, conducted a detailed study of the palate of oxen using a microscope. He discovered the presence of small, round, transparent drops and observed that the palate had a complex structure with numerous small protuberances, holes, and fibers. He also found that the taste sensation was produced by long particles that received juices. This research provided valuable insights into the anatomy and physiology of the palate and taste sensation.
